answers.answer: A Hygiene War reduces access to basic needs such as water, heat, food, and hygiene.
answers.instruction: Go to website https://dopomoha.ro/en/hygiene and read the page carefully.

answers.answer: To properly wash hands with soap, open the tap, soap your palms, carefully rub the inside and back, wash off the soap, and then close the tap. In a public place, it's best to open and close the faucet with a paper towel.
answers.instruction: Go to website https://dopomoha.ro/en/hygiene and read the section under 'How to wash your hands properly?'.

answers.answer: If soap and water are unavailable, use a hand sanitizer with at least 60% alcohol, rubbing it for 20-30 seconds, or use alcohol or antibacterial wet wipes. Antiseptic or alcohol-based products can also be used.
answers.instruction: Go to website https://dopomoha.ro/en/hygiene and read the section under 'What to do if there is no or limited access to soap and water'.

answers.answer: Hands should be washed often with soap after visiting the toilet, after being on public transport, touching surfaces outside the house (including money), before cooking and eating, after contact with a pet, and before any self-care or child-care procedures.
answers.instruction: Go to website https://dopomoha.ro/en/hygiene and read the section under 'Hand washing'.

answers.answer: In times of crisis, one person needs about 7.5 litres of water per day if mostly in an apartment/house, for body washing, cooking, drinking, and washing dishes.
answers.instruction: Go to website https://dopomoha.ro/en/hygiene and read the page carefully.

answers.answer: In a bomb shelter, daily water needs per person are 1.5 litres of drinking water and 0.5-1 litres of technical water for hygiene, with the need decreasing depending on storage capacity and ready-to-eat food availability.
answers.instruction: Go to website https://dopomoha.ro/en/hygiene and read the page carefully.

answers.answer: If using a common glass or mug, it should be thoroughly washed before drinking, with the edges especially well-washed with detergents, as they touch the lips and can transfer pathogens.
answers.instruction: Go to website https://dopomoha.ro/en/hygiene and read the section under 'Use of utensils'.

answers.answer: Children should use their own individual or disposable dishes, and if shared, the common glass or mug must be thoroughly washed with detergents, especially the edges. It is also not recommended to drink water from the tap with lips directly on it.
answers.instruction: Go to website https://dopomoha.ro/en/hygiene and read the section under 'Use of utensils'.

answers.answer: To make a gauze diaper, fold a piece of gauze in 3-4 layers as a paddle, then make a triangle from another cut and place the paddle on it. Place the baby on the triangle so the paddle reaches the middle of the back, fold the triangle like panties, and carefully trim the edges.
answers.instruction: Go to website https://dopomoha.ro/en/hygiene and read the section under 'How to make a diaper out of gauze'.

answers.answer: To make a cloth diaper, fold the cloth in four and bend it towards you, then place a finger between the folds while holding the tip with the other hand. Push its end to make a triangle, turn the cloth triangle upside down, and fold the remaining residue into two layers to form a gasket in the middle.
answers.instruction: Go to website https://dopomoha.ro/en/hygiene and read the section under 'How to make a diaper from a piece of cloth'.

answers.answer: To reuse disposable diapers, soak them in water to swell the internal gel, make a horizontal incision to remove the gel and contents, then rinse and dry the diapers. Afterward, insert a gauze or cloth pad into the pocket of the dry diaper, changing it as necessary.
answers.instruction: Go to website https://dopomoha.ro/en/hygiene and read the section under 'How to use disposable diapers several times'.
